title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage – Nicole M. Johnson, July 2021 Essex Traffic Stop

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage – Nicole M. Johnson, July 2021 Essex Traffic Stop
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act (MPIA), I respectfully request access to the following records related to the July 28–29, 2021 traffic stop in Essex, Maryland, in which officers discovered the deceased minors in the vehicle of Nicole M. Johnson:

- All body-worn camera recordings from officers present.
- Any dashcam or in-car camera video.
- All interview room / holding cell video or audio connected to this case.
- Any 911 call audio or related CAD dispatch recordings.
- The full incident and arrest reports, including supplemental reports.
- Any evidence photos or video created during the stop, arrest, or subsequent investigation.
- All associated dispatch logs and radio communications.

If any portions of the requested materials are exempt, please release all reasonably segregable portions and provide a written justification for any redactions or withholdings.

I request these records in electronic format whenever possible. Please notify me in advance if fees will exceed $50.

This request is being made for journalistic/documentary purposes, and disclosure of these records is in the public interest.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Shaw

title: Public Records Act Request – Location Tracking & Corporate Data Disclosures

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Public Records Act Request – Location Tracking & Corporate Data Disclosures



Dear Records Officer,



This is a request under the California Public Records Act (Gov. Code §§ 7922.000 et seq.) [or FOIA for federal agencies].



I request all records from January 1, 2017, to Present relating to the acquisition, use, or receipt of location-tracking or telematics data from corporations, including but not limited to:



Corporate Disclosures
Records of data received from Google, Apple, Verizon (SimpleMobile ), AT&T, T-Mobile ( UltraMobile ), Toyota, GM OnStar, Tesla, or any telematics/fleet vendor.
Include subpoenas, warrants, exigent requests, geofence warrants, tower dumps, and voluntary corporate disclosures.

Communications
Emails, memos, contracts, or policies regarding partnerships with corporations for location-tracking.
Meeting agendas/minutes discussing corporate data-sharing.

Discriminatory/Targeted Use
Any deployment plans, reports, or after-action reviews referencing use of corporate data in:
“Narcotics,” “gang,” “protest,” or “high-crime” investigations.
Any analysis tied to race, ethnicity, religion, or protest activity.


Policies & Proposals
Internal policies or proposals outlining when and how corporate telematics/location data may be requested or used.
